availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Veach (Webster Co., ky, laborer and pvt 8th ky mtd inf (csa))

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Veach and Eliza Veach. Resident of Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Webster County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as a private from October 9, 1862 to July 22, 1863. Captured at Fort Donelson on February 16, 1862. Died of disease while in service on July 22, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 109A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 477.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0127.
